Package slitherio.gameobjects

Class GameObject

java.lang.Object
slitherio.gameobjects.GameObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
Food, Segment
public abstract class GameObject extends Object
Représente les objets "physiques" du jeu. Elle fonctionne avec des DoupleProperty représentation sa position (x,y), ses dimensions (width, height) et son angle de rotation. Chaque objet possède une vitesse en x et en y (dx et dy respectivement). Cette objet doit être considéré comme un rectangle !

  • Method Details

    • collides

      public final boolean collides(GameObject go)
      Return true if the object collides go. Collides working: l = left, r = right, u = up, d = down. [l1 < r2] ∧ [l2 < r1] ∧ [u1 < d2] ∧ [u2 < d1] ⟺ l1 - r2 < 0 < r1 - l2 ∧ u1 - d2 < 0 < d1 - u2
      Parameters:
      go -
      Returns:
      true if the object collides go.

    • collides

      public final boolean collides(double maxX, double maxY)
      Return true if the object collides the rectangle delimited by the coordinates (0,0) and (maxX,maxY). In other words, return true if the object is neither strictly in nor strictly out of bounds delimited by coordinates (0,0) and (maxX,maxY).
      Parameters:
      maxX - limit of the X-coordinate.
      maxY - limit of the Y-coordinate.
      Returns:
      true if the object collides the rectangle delimited by the coordinates (0,0) and (maxX,maxY).

    • isOut

      public final boolean isOut(double maxX, double maxY)
      Return true if the object is strictly out of bounds delimited by coordinates (0,0) and (maxX,maxY).
      Parameters:
      maxX - limit of the X-coordinate.
      maxY - limit of the Y-coordinate.
      Returns:
      true if the object is strictly out of bounds delimited by (0,0) and (maxX, maxY).
